metadata.synopsis: A dialog with Danthelon's Dancing Axe shopkeeper Danthelon. He facilitates Jaheira's Harpers having a meeting in his basement, and is an old and long-suffering friend of hers.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main, from debug book Go to Region -> Act3 -> Wyrm's Crossing -> Axe Trader. Enter the shop, talk to Danthelon.

10.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
10.text: I wouldn't keep your contact waiting. Looked a mite twitchy.
10.context:
InternalNodeContext: Talk again to Danthelon before seeing harpers.
GROUP_Players can be Jaheira or not. Dedicated Jaheira slot is empty

123.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
123.text: Unless you're buying - then he can wait 'til the Soul Forge goes dark.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Entharl - the Harpers are dead. Doppelgangers took their place.

34.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
34.text: Doppelgangers...? If this is some kind of Harper test, friend, you'll find I'm testy enough by myself.

73.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
73.text: Greetings, saer. Your noble bearing brings a little class to my humble establishment.
73.context:
InternalNodeContext: Meet Danthelon before going to harpers basement
No JaheiraNodeContext: Air of salesman, but a little tired - like he's making this pitch by rote

128.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
128.text: How may I be of service?
128.context: NodeContext: Air of salesman, but a little tired - like he's making this pitch by rote

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Jaheira sent me. I'm to meet some Harpers here.

117.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
117.text: Harpers? I'm afraid I serve a grubbier class of clientele than that.
117.context: NodeContext: Feigned ignorance, not overdone. Just bemused: 'no sir, I definitely don't work for that super spy network'

92.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
92.text: More chancers than champions, if you take my meaning. Present company excluded, I'm sure.
92.context: NodeContext: Cheery tone - his clientele aren't nearly so NOBLE or HEROIC as the Harpers

116.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
116.text: No, I don't know any... Jaheira, was it?
116.context: NodeContext: Trailing off, still feigning ignorance, trying to get us off the topic

30.speaker: Player
30.text: It was. And she certainly knows who you are.

48.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
48.text: I knew it. I knew she wasn't dead.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Exaggerated looking aroud before leaning in to speak in quieter tones, the salesman act goneNodeContext: looking aroud before leaning in to speak in quieter tones, the salesman act gone

44.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
44.text: Fine, yes - you have the right place. But where's the leaf-licker herself?
44.context: NodeContext: Fully dropping the act - now looking to us to update on what went wrong / why Jaheira isn't here

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Elsewhere, but she trusts me with this.

9.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
9.text: She wouldn't have revealed this place otherwise. Which makes you one of the rare breed she does trust.
9.context: NodeContext: Eyeing us up and down. Should be dubious as to whether being trusted by Jaheira is a thing to be proud of or not, despite him belonging in the same camp.

107.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
107.text: Here's the key. The others are below - and bearing bad news, by the looks of it.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Before that - is there time to trade?

112.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
112.context: NodeContext: emphasis on second word - he's being sarcastic, but not aggressively so

115.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
115.text: Make your way below. The others are waiting - with bad news, by the looks of it.

37.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
37.text: Needless paranoia. Had you opened with that, I'd have known you for a Harper straight off.
37.context: NodeContext: Crisp, classifying us immediately - not at all bothered by our self-important secrecy

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Stop lying. Jaheira's been known to feed people truth-herbs.

125.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
125.text: ...Klauthgrass. I know the taste all too well. You too, I'd wager.
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Exaggerated looking aroud before leaning in to speak in quieter tones, the salesman act goneNodeContext:  looking aroud before leaning in to speak in quieter tones, the salesman act gone

2.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
2.text: Anything else I can aid you with?

137.speaker: Jaheira
137.text: I'm glad you're safe, Entharl. My Harpers - they were replaced by doppelgangers.
137.context: InternalNodeContext: Feels like she'd be happy he's unharmed, but since we lack any more lines we can get from him, maybe this is overkill. Specifically here if Jaheira knows about her Harpelgangers but the player hasn't talked about it yet/NodeContext: Breaking grim news as gently as she can, but angry about it herself

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Did you know the Harpers here were actually doppelgangers?
51.context: InternalNodeContext: After the fact - You've bypassed Danthelon's entirely, meaning the Doppels got away, then come back.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Let's see what you have to trade.

78.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
78.text: What, by the Mordinsamman's curlies, went on down there?
78.context: InternalNodeContext: After combat with doppelgangers happened in shop's basement.NodeContext: Hissed through gritted teeth - he heard sounds of violence below.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Our Harpers turned out to be shapeshifter assassins.

42.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
42.context: NodeContext: Quietly furious, not appreciating our joke

38.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
38.text: So you'd be one of Jaheira's then, would you?
38.context: NodeContext: Grudgingly locking down his anger to get on with things - eyeing us up and down. If we're with Jaheira, then he's going to help us.

124.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
124.text: Clear out, then. I'm guessing I have some tidying to do before the Steel Watch squeals by.
124.context: NodeContext: Sigh, locking down anger as he resigns himself to help clear up another Harper mess

102.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
102.text: Clear out, then. I have some tidying to do in case the Watchers get up and running again.
102.context: NodeContext: Sigh, locking down anger as he resigns himself to help clear up another Harper mess

133.speaker: Player
133.text: That's it, no more questions asked?

28.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
28.text: Plenty, but I'll bend Jaheira's pointy old ears when all of this is done. She'll owe me a whole cask of drinks by then.

71.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
71.text: I've had enough dealings with Harpers to know I don't want the answers. Go on, now.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I'd like to see your wares first.

101.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
101.text: I don't care much for your timing, but I like your gold well enough.

79.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
79.text: If your lot have cracked another bloody cask, I -
79.context:
InternalNodeContext: Meet Danthelon after fighting harpers doppelgangers
Jaheira is in Jaheira speakerNodeContext: Irritated by the Harper kerfuffle below, but cutting off when he realises something is actually wrong.

67.speaker: Jaheira
67.text: They're dead, Entharl. Doppelgangers were using them as bait.

105.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
105.text: Seems they snared more than they could skin in you. Did Geraldus survive?
105.context: NodeContext: A breath, taking the bad news and refocusing himself on the task.

56.speaker: Jaheira
56.text: Alive. But he'll need some time to recover.

135.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
135.text: I'll tuck the boy up tight 'til he's ready to get back to Harpering. What will you do?
135.context: NodeContext: Nod, all bluster gone. He'll help the Harpers, because he always does.

0.speaker: Jaheira
0.text: Alive. But a Harper no more. He's better off out of it.

4.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
4.text: Likely you're right. I'll tuck him up tight 'til I can ship him back to his mother. What are you going to do?
4.context: NodeContext: Nod, all bluster gone. He'll help the Harpers, because he always does.

118.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
118.context: NodeContext: Sighing, knows he won't get more from her so not going to stand in her way.

61.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
61.text: Waste. A bloody waste. What will you do now?
61.context: NodeContext: Quiet frustration and sadness - he talks a lot of shit about Harpers, but Geraldus was just a kid.

84.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
84.text: Greetings, saer. Your noble bearing brings a little class to my humble -
84.context:
InternalNodeContext: Meet Danthelon before going to harpers basement
Jaheira is in Jaheira speaker slotNodeContext: Repeating sales pitch by rote without initially looking at who's at his counter - cuts off when he sees

108.speaker: Jaheira
108.text: You can turn off the charm, Entharl. They're with me.

96.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
96.text: Blueberries. Thought I had a sale. You look tired, Harper.
96.context: NodeContext: 'Blueberries' - seemingly a polite curse, but with all the vehemence of 'balls / bollocks'

97.speaker: Jaheira
97.text: I missed you too. They're already here?

18.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
18.context: NodeContext: Sighing, now certain he's not making a sale but getting on with business.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: We were looking for a safe-house. This doesn't look like one.

103.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
103.text: Agreed. Didn't stop Jaheira's lot from nesting in my cellar.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Pleased to meet you, Harper Entharl.

95.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
95.text: You seem a nice sort, so I'll assume the insult was accidental.
95.context: NodeContext: Polite tone of threat, no actual venom in it.

89.speaker: Jaheira
89.text: Entharl's no Harper, and claims no love for those who are. But he's been known to shelter us when we need it.

50.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
50.text: Entharl has been known to charge rent. Harpers have been known to ignore him.

52.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
52.text: Now go on. The Short Father may send me an actual paying customer today.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Wait. I would like to take a look at your stock.

136.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
136.text: To buy?  You're already my favourite.

17.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
17.text: A pleasure. Jaheira needs more friends like you.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Do Harpers ever just stop and say hello?

120.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
120.text: Hah! Clearly, you do not know our Harper most High.
120.context: NodeContext: Snort of derision and sarcastic spin on the title - High Harper Jaheira is an old friend of his.

16.speaker: Jaheira
16.text: I wouldn't say that. We've travelled a long road together in a short time.

91.speaker: Jaheira
91.text: The others will be taking their ease here. Entharl has been known to shelter Harpers when they need it.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: You're a trader, Entharl? Let's see your stock.

138.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
138.text: Oh aye, Helm forbid someone might pay for my services, Jaheira.
138.context: NodeContext: Defensive at Jaheira, who's trying to interrupt an actual sale

106.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
106.text: Harpers nesting in your cellar tends to scare off business. So if you mean to sling some coin around, only Jaheira will complain.
106.context: NodeContext: Back to us, eager to trade

11.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
11.text: Bah. She might make a Harper of you yet.
11.context: NodeContext: Grunt - we have disappointed him, but he'll get over it

98.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
98.text: Down below. Can't find the key, but a locked door's never stopped you.
98.context: NodeContext: Sighing, now certain he's not making a sale but getting on with business.

88.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
88.context:
InternalNodeContext: After first meeting Danthelon or After doppelganger scene and after Danthelon knows about it
Jaheira is speaker in GROUP_Players speakerNodeContext: Mock formality to Jaheira - they're old friends, and she never actually buys anything

93.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
93.text: And who the hells are you, and what were you doing down there?
93.context: InternalNodeContext: After combat with doppelgangers happened in shop's basement.NodeContext: Hushed fury, but reining it in while he waits for our answer.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Meeting the Harpers below. Turns out they were doppelgangers.

132.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
132.text: Of course. Of course they bloody did.

90.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
90.text: That depends - you plan on buying anything?

41.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
41.context: NodeContext: Wistful - Harpers never buy anything from him.

121.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
121.context:
InternalNodeContext: After first meeting Danthelon or After doppelganger scene and after Danthelon knows about it
No Jaheira speaker

127.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
127.text: Haven't seen any Harpers come up. They still down there, frothing over battle-plans?
127.context:
InternalNodeContext: Talk again to Danthelon after recognizing harpers as doppelgangers (no fight yet).
GROUP_Players can be Jaheira or not. Dedicated Jaheira slot is empty

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I think they're impostors - preparing an ambush.

35.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
35.text: ...No. Not Geraldus. Boy's too honest. The others? Not sure.

24.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
24.text: But what are you doing up here? Jaheira might not need your help, but she'd surely appreciate it.
24.context: InternalNodeContext: No Jaheira in this branch.

76.speaker: Entharl Danthelon
76.text: But what are you doing up here? The boy is in danger!

69.speaker: Player
69.text: They are. I'd like to trade.
